verses.verse: For the conclusion. A Psalm by David. An Ode. To thee, O God, a hymn in Sion is seemly: and to thee a vow should be paid.
Hearken to my prayer. To thee all flesh should come.
The acts of transgressors prevailed over us: but thou canst pardon our sins.
Happy he, whom thou hast chosen and taken to thyself! He shall dwell in thy courts. Let us be satisfied with the good things of thy house: thy temple is holy.
Thou art wonderful for righteousness: hear us O God, our Saviour. Thou art the hope of all the ends of the earth: and of them at sea far off.
Thou establishest the mountains by thy power: thou art begirt with majesty.
Thou causest the cavity of the sea to rage; the billows thereof to roar.
When nations are troubled and the inhabitants on its borders terrified at thy signs; thou canst make the outgoings of the morning and evening joyous.

Thou hast visited the earth and watered it: thou hast multiplied the means of enriching it. The river of God is full of water: thou hast provided the supply for it. Because such is thy provision, O! water its furrows plenteously: multiply its productions.
By these showers on it, it will be gladdened; and will give a spring to vegetation.
Bless the crown of the year with thy goodness: and let the fields be filled with fatness;
let the mountains of the wilderness be made fertile; and the hills be girt with joy.
The rams of the flocks have clothed themselves: and the valleys abound with corn. Let them shout and hymn thy praise.
